Name: Book of Nox
Description:
Book of Nox is a horror dungeon crawler which follows the adventures of a Group of Victorians exploring strange lands and battling a host of evil cultists and monsters in a traditional Victorian setting.

At the setup of the game a story is chosen. (six included) The Games Master prepares the adventure. All the rooms and corridor cards are shuffled. The cards are revealed when a player explores the next doorway. 
When a card is revealed dice are rolled to determine the encounters for that specific room.

A turn consists of three phases:

     Players phase:


During a turn a player must perform two actions (move, attack, push, swap weapons, put down/pick up lantern, open door).

     Monsters phase


After all players have acted, the monsters will attack. The monsters also perform two actions.

     Upkeep phase:


This is the tidy up phase, certain actions are resolved  now and it will state in the description when an action resolves in the upkeep phase.

The game is won if the players achieve the objective of the story.

—description from the publisher

Name: Team Yankee: Free Nations
Description:
Canadian, French, Dutch and Australian Forces in World War III

Since its inception in 1949, NATO has been a community of free nations brought together with a common goal, to defend the freedom of Western Europe and North America. To do this, Canada, France, and the Netherlands deploy armoured and mechanised forces in West Germany.

Old allies have also been called on, and an ANZAC Brigade of Australian and New Zealand troops answers the call to fight. Canada, the Netherlands, and Australia all have 105mm armed Leopard 1 tanks, while both Canada and the ANZACs have M113 mechanised infantry. France has its own 105mm armed AMX-30 tank, while infantry travel in AMX-10P IFVs or 4x4 VAB APCs. The Dutch also have new Leopard 2 tanks and mount their infantry in YPR-765 IFVs.

Recon options include the Canadian Lynx and Dutch M113 C&V tracked vehicles and the heavily armed French AMX-10 RC armoured car. Among the many support choices there are Canadian and Dutch M109 artillery, French rapid fire AMX AuF1 SP 155mm howitzers, Canadian ADATS, French Roland and Mephisto, and Dutch PRAT missile vehicles.

Inside this book, you'll find:
• Background on the 4 Canadian Mechanized Brigade Group, French Armée de terre, the Netherlands 1. Korps, and the Australian and New Zealand ANZAC Brigade.

• Instructions on how to build:
  â€£ A Canadian Leopard C1 Armoured Squadron or a M113 Mechanized Company
  â€£ A French AMX-30 Escadron Blindé, AMX-10P Compagnie de Chasseurs, AMX-10 RC Escadron de Cavalerie, or VAB Compagnie d'Infanterie
  â€£ A Dutch Leopard 2 Tank Eskadron, Leopard 1 Tank Eskadron, Pantserinfanterie Compagnie, or Verkennings Eskadron
  â€£ An Australian Leopard AS1 Armoured Squadron, or M113 Mechanised Company

• Three scenarios featuring the forces of Free Nations.

• A detailed painting guide to help you prepare your army

Name: Fairy God Plumber
Description:
Fairy God Plumber is a cheeky card game about matching the mythical monster poop to win. Find more matches than your opponent, and avoid (or take advantage of) special hazard cards.

For 2-4 players, 6 and up, 15-20 minutes playtime, sure to be a fun hit with anyone's collection.

—description from the publisher

Name: Happy Festivus
Description:
This game is based on the Seinfeld television show and the "Festivus" holiday created in one episode. Players are represented by a Festivus Pole as they move around the board performing feats of strength, expressing grievances, or one of the other Festivus events. Like it says on the box, this is a Festivus for the rest of us! The player who best demonstrates the true meaning of Festivus is declared the winner.

Includes board, cards, dice, four plastic Festivus Poles, grievance notepads, etc.

A game for teenagers and adults.

—description from the publisher

Name: アークライト20 (Arclight Twenty)
Description:
The CEO Fukumoto has decided to give a bonus to just one employee. But, as he likes games, he's said that whoever can guess who that was, will share the bonus with that character.

Out of 20 roles, one is put out of the game, and the goal of the game is for the remaining players to guess what role that is. The remaining 19 roles will be dealt to the players, and the players will use these as "connections" in the company to find out what other cards the other players have. Your cards will be revealed by the actions of other players, but once face up, they will have additional effects that work to your advantage.

The first player to figure out the card that was put away, is the winner of the game.

Arclight Twenty is a game of deduction.  It’s a memorabilia for 20 years anniversary of Arclight Inc., and was given only to the people that have involved in their jobs.  It is said only 400 copies are printed.

Name: Xeno Siege
Description:
You are the only soldier remaining. Xenomorph invaders have wiped out your entire squad. You figure the sentry guns could help thin out the Xenomorphs so you can get to some spare supplies. With the right upgrades to your combat suit, you may be able to take on the Xeno Queen and put an end to this siege.

Xeno Siege is solitaire game of resource management. Choose 1 of 5 Combat Units equipped with variable weaponry. Your unit is powered by 2 sources of energy, represented by blue and yellow dice. Roll and place these dice to activate actions to move, attack, and upgrade your combat unit.

For the final battle, face 1 of 5 Xeno Queens, each with its own special attack and defense. Will your upgraded Combat Unit stand a chance against the ferocious Xeno Queen?

—description from the designer

Name: Germany's next topmodel
Description:
Taken from the back of the box:

Goal of the game is to become "Germany's next Topmodel". To achieve this, clothes and Makeup has to be close to perfect and also the performance on the catwalk must be the best possible.

Each player gets one pawn, symbolic for a model and one of five model-sedcards, showing only body contures. Each player tries to get the right clothes in his prep room and optimize the combinations to score high on the cat walk. At the same time, each player collects cards, which have an great impact on his or her performance - positive like negative!

Contents:
5 sedcards
6 pawns
6 clothing sets consisting of 4 pieces each
110 cards
2 six-sided dice
1 Gameboard
1 rulebook

Name: Multiplication War
Description: Multiplication War is a version of the classic card game War with a twist, designed to teach multiplication facts. Players are dealt an equal number of the 86 cards showing multiplication problems. Like in war, each player then turns over a card. They must then solve the multiplication problem displayed on the card. The player with the highest answer wins and takes all the cards. If a player's answer is wrong, he or she gives her card to the player to the right. A wild card automatically gains all the cards in that round for the player who plays it. Like in wars, equal answers result in a "war" where players play two face-down cards and the an face-up card, and the winner wins all the cards. Players play a predetermined number of times through the deck or until one player has all the cards.

Name: Tutti Frutti
Description:
Tutti Frutti - fill up your plate!

There is nothing more healthy than fresh fruits. They don't add weight, help with digestion, have lots of vitamins - a game where you can easily fill up your plate. Maybe this wets your appetite for delicious fruits!

In the game, each player gets a cardboard plate. The 38 slices of fruits are openly placed upon the table. The special thing about the game is the size of the slices. The smallest have the number 1, the biggest the number 6. In between there are the other sizes with values from 2 to 5. A player rolls a six-sided dice and may take a slice accoding to the rolled number, putting it on the plate. As time goes on, the plate fills up. Goal of the game is to get slices exactly reaching 36 points of value - then the plate will completely filled. Who first fills his plate up, wins the game!

Name: Kwispel
Description:
Equipment
Playboard with 6 horizontal fields numbered 1 to 6
40 Strips with a word which gives a category
a series of letters
1 coored stone
2 dice

In each of the numbered fields on the game board 1 word strip is placed. All other word strips are given to the players.

At players turn, he can choose to roll 1 die to get this number of new letters or to build a word which matches a category on the board or one of his own words with the letters he has.
If he has a matching word for a category on the board he gets points for each letter the word is long multiplied with the number in front of the word.

If he has a word to one of his categories, he has to place his category on one of the places on the board.
He is not free in the selection of the place. The last placed category is marked with the colored stone. Normally the player has to choose a field with a lower number.
There are 2 circumstances where he can choose another:
1. The marked field is field 1
2. The number of letters is higher than the number of the blocked field.
The points are calculated in the same way, number of letters multiplied by the number of the field.
At the end of the players turn the colored stone is always placed on the word category which was used.

The game ends if one player has reached the defined points (e.g. 500). This player wins.

Name: Vorsicht Falle
Description:
From the side of the box:

The goal of the game is to bring four marbles over a swiveling round board into the target. Each player tries to spin the round board at the right moment to trap the opponents marbles.

Contents:
16 colored marbles
1 spinable game board
1 six-sided dice
1 rulebook

Name: Race around the World
Description:
From the back of the box:

In this game, you'll visit one country after another, to tour marked cities and end the voyage in the starting city. Each Race has to be finished within limited time. Sometimes, an exciting adventure emerges, for exampe, a treasure hunt. Marked Cities are to visit, treasures to collect and bring to another city.

Sounds easy? Some rules are to obey:

- on each map, all places must be visited in a closed circle
- the direction of the next move is marked by an arrow
- each city may only be visited once
- there a special fields on the map to change direction

Contents:
1 game board
24 maps
1 transparent foil
1 erasable marker
1 eraser

Name: High Society: Wie werde ich prominent?
Description:
Content:
Gameboard
5 white cones
4 figures of each of the 6 player colors
120 chips in 4 colors (categories of fame) 
1 die

The board shows a round turn with 6 different fields:
grey fields: Starting places for the white cones
4 different "fame fields"
"Door of success" fields

At players turn he role the die and moves 1 of the 5 white cones.
If the cone ends on a fame field he gets 1 chip of the adjustend color.
If he ends on a "Door of success" fields he pushes open the door.
At each players turn he is allowed to pay up to 3 chips to enclime the ladder of success. He has to open the "Door of success" to be allowed to do this. From the rules it's not clear if he has to do this 1 time for all 4 ladders (one for each category) or only one time for all.
It's also possible to interpret the rules that you are only allowed to do this when you move on a "Door of success" field. 
If you come exactly on the same field as anothers players figure you have to fight with rolling a die. The higher number stays on the field, the lower number has to climb down to the next free field. The defending player wins ties. 
On the highest level, the defending player is allowed to role 3 dice where the highest is taken for the compare.

The player who has reached the highest position of 2 ladders wins the game.

Name: Partyspaß mit Didi Hallervorden: Fünf verrückte Partyspiele lassen kein Auge trocken
Description:
This game consists of 5 little games which can be played as a tournament one after each other, where the player with the most points wins or each game as a single game.

Didi Hallervorder is a famous German comedian, actor in funny films and moderator e.g. from "Hidden Camera". This game is a party game. Didi is known to participate for each joke and this is the reason written in the rules why his name is in the title and his image is in all games.

The games:
1. Pinch the Didi (Zwick' den Didi). A spinning circle is in the middle and a path for a kind of race. The players pinch their little clothes peg at the edge of the spinning circle.
At all positions there is an action e.g. move 3 fields, suspend 2 turns.
These actions are executed, normally moving forward your figure on the path.
After the round 1 or more players reach the finish line this game ends. The points each player gets are written on the path.

2. Didi listen (Didi horch einmal):
5 little balls: 4 empty and 1 with stones in it.
1 4 part puzzle showing Didis face for each player. 
The active player takes all the balls in his hands and tries to hear which is the stone filled. Each player who is right gets 1 piece of his 4 piece puzzle. Who has finished first gets 5 points all others 1 point for each piece.

3. Didi eats chinese (Didi ißt chinesisch):
Feet a Didi figure with your chips using chopsticks like in China. Game ends when 1 player has feet all his chips. He gets 1 bonus point. Each player gets 1 point for each of his chips Didi has eaten.

4. Jiggle Didi (Wackel-Didi)
There is a jiggling figure of Didi in the middle of the table. Each player tries to get rid of his chips by placing them on the hat of the Didi figure. If chips fall down, the player gets them. The player who has placed the last chip on Didi wins this game and gets 1 point. Each other player gets 1 point minus for each chip he still has.

5. Didis gymnastic party (Didis Party-Gymnastik)
There is a start and finish sign. These are placed in 4 m distance.
A stack of cards is shuffeled. Each of the cards shows a kind of gymnastic figure. The actual player opens the top card. This shows how to hold the arms and feets and where to place chips on the body for his run. With this positions the actual player tries to transport as many of these chips without that they fall down. Each chip which is still in place at the finish gives 1 point. The rules do not mention how many rounds this game is played.

Playing with more than 4 players you have to build teams.

Name: Landpower: GAAT
Description:
Landpower: GAAT (the Georgia, Armenia, Azerbaijan, Turkey scenario) is a wargame designed by LTC Patrick Schoof at the U.S. Army Command and General Staff College and used for instruction in academic year 2018.

Landpower is designed to drive both sides to plan and conduct sequential operations in a large scale combat environment. Many parts of shaping and combat are intentionally abstracted to allow the intended training audience to focus on appropriate decisions at the division echelon as a division commander and staff. The mechanics of the game are intentionally minimized above and below the echelon of decision. A well-planned operation with its events synchronized usually works most of the time. A poorly planned large scale operation will likely result in failure. Friction is intentionally built in! Landpower was designed to meet educational learning objectives while still being able to stand alone as a wargame. Because of this, most of the instructions ask the reader to treat the conduct of it as an exercise. In the classroom, Landpower is not about the game, but rather the discussion the wargame elicits.

The exercise is conducted over a series of days. Each day is broken down into four, six-hour turns. During the turns each side will have opportunities to conduct operations to achieve their side’s objectives.

The scenario in Landpower is conducted mostly in Azerbaijan based on the GAAT (Georgia, Armenia, Azerbaijan, and Turkey) terrain. Each hex is roughly 6.5km across. The terrain has been abstracted for the division echelon of decision with consideration given to possible second order effects of a particular feature’s inclusion or exclusion from the exercise. For example, the terrain at 39°56'42.3"N 48°21'00.4"E was treated as urban, and the northwest-southeast road was omitted because it would not change operations, though the bridge was retained.

—description from the designer

Name: Schnüffel-Nase (Eine spannende Ganovenjagd)
Description:
Contents:
In this game there are 28 rouge chips (each rouge of 7 rouges is 4 times available), 7 team marker, 1 dog and 7 smaller rouge chips for determining the order.

Gameplay:
In this memory game 2 to 4 players have to find 7 different rouge chips in a certain order, which was determinded¬¬¬¬¬ at the start of the game. The first player to find all the rouge chips in the right order is the winner.

At the start of the game one player shuffles 28 (21 for 2 players) rouge chips and places them face down on the table. Then 7 groups are formed. Each group consists of 4 (3 for 2 players) rouge concealed chips.

At the start of the turn the active player takes the dog and places it next to one of the seven teams (not the team it has come from) and flips one of the rouge chips. If it is the next rouge the player has to find, the chip is placed in front of the player. If it is not, the chip is placed face down again. In any case the turn of that player ends.

Name: Train
Description:
The players undertake certain actions to build a railtrack from space S to space Z, while connecting 4 cities in between. The Players draw Action cards. If a player completes an action keeps the card. The game ends when all action cards have been played. The player with the most action cards wins the game.

Additionally to laying tracks (round yellow tokens), the players have to develop the 4 cities by building houses, delivering resources and building bridges over the river.

The materials are transported with one cube, that functions as a helicopter (H), a truck (L) or a ship (S), depending which symbol shows on top. All players use the same cube. If a player can't complete his action in one turn, the next player may use his collected materials as he takes control of the cube. The transport capacity of the cube and it's ability to move over the terrain depends on which vehicle the cube represents at the time. Movement of the cube is like a queen at Chess. Each player has 3 movements per turn. Before each movement the player may change direction and/or the mode of transport.

The tracks are stored at the factory at the middle of the game board. The resources (blue square tokens) are placed on the 3 terrain markers with the neutral side up. They have to be transported to the factory, where they get stored their symbol side up (house, resources, bridge). From three they have to be transported to the 4 cities according to the actions appointed by the action cards.

—user summary

Name: Der interaktive Globus puzzle ball
Description:
Contents:
In this game there are 96 puzzle pieces, 1 stand for the 3D puzzle ball, 1 control panel for using the tiptoi pen.
In order to play the game each player needs a tiptoi pen which is not included in the game.

Gameplay:
In this game the players have to find places or animals on earth.

At the start of the game the players need to solve a 3D puzzle of earth.

There are 4 different game versions:

1st version:
In order to win the active player needs to find the most places on earth within 1 minute.

2nd version:
In order to win the active player is the last player in the game. The tiptoi sets one condition and each player needs to find one place on earth which fits the description. If it is wrong the player leaves the game until only the winner is left.

3rd version:
The last player in the game is the winner. 
The active player puts the tiptoi on an animal. All players can hear the sound of the animal. The next player has to find the previous animals and add another. Each player who can´t find all the animals in the right order leaves the game.

4th version:
The last player in the game is the winner.
At the start of this version the players decide how long one round is to last (set in tiptoi pen). The active player names a place on earth the next player has to find. The active player at the end of the round (sound signal) leaves the game.

Name: トゥーヴァイ (Two Wei)
Description:
There will be a new king in this country. The firstborn prince was scheduled to become king, but has dies just before taking the throne. It seems the second born has cheated his way to the throne. The king, who gave preferential treatment to his recently lost firstborn issues a decree!

“This is outrageous! I will instead reward the person who comes second in five essential skills!”

So, will you be able to come second, as the king prefers?

This is a tricktaking game. Players put out cards one by one and wins a group of cards called a “trick” by following the rules. You will receive points from the King depending on the number of cards you have won, but remember the King will only reward those in second place.

The number of rounds played is equal to the number of players. The player with the most points at the end of the game is the winner.

Name: Ballotage
Description:
Ballotage is a game about politics. Each player is the head of a political party, but also has the secret objective of getting certain politicians to the top. These may or may not be from their own party. 
Each player has a party list and assigns spots on that list to four politicians. These lists are then simultaneously revealed. Then there is a vote. Everyone puts a few ballot papers into the ballot box. Afterwards, this is opened and the votes are counted. Votes that a party gets mean that the top candidate(s) from this party move up the political ladder. This is repeated a few times until one politician becomes the president. Whoever had this politician on their secret agenda, scores a point. 
This is repeated a few times, and the player with most points wins the game.

Name: La Bataille de Deutsch-Wagram 1809
Description:
7 Maps and 1500 Counters recreate second largest Napoleonic Wars battle between French and Austrian Forces and is major contest to conclude War of Fifth Coalition. Game includes 100 page plus editorial booklet.

Includes rules; charts and editorial pieces only available with game purchase. Game can be linked to Aspern-Essling by use of special scenarios.

The game will recreate the intense and grinding battle which occurred on July 5, 1809 and July 6, 1809 just outside Vienna between the 165,000 strong army of the French Empire led by the Emperor Napoleon; and the 145,000 strong Austrian army, under the Archduke Charles. The game is not a reprint of ME’s original title published in the early 1980’s, but is an all new game with all new research for the orders of battle and the maps.

The game can be linked to ME’s La Bataille d’Aspern Essling 1809, or played without AE. There is a second game as part of the Wagram package called Drive to the Bridges includes the action near the Danube River occurring at the same time as Wagram. This game is an area movement contest.

There are several new features to La Bataille de Deutsch-Wagram 1809 including a new terrain type called a feldlager—a sort of fortified semi-permanent encampment; special rules for Marshal Massena travelling via carriage during the battle; and the possibility of the Archduke John arriving at the battlefield in time to interject his fresh troops to assist his tired brother’s army and defeat the French.
Families: Series: La Bataille (Marshal Enterprises / Clash of Arms Games)

Name: Icos
Description:
In Icos, you play a wandering hero; accepting and completing quests offered to you by the people of that fair land.  
you will encounter hazards, monsters, and companions that impede or aid your journey. you can obtain a variety of resources, which enable you to take on greater dangers  The first hero to gather great renoun will become the Hero of Icos.

Icos is a world still in its humble beginnings. The people know the settled land and the sinister wilderness that bounds it, and little else. 
But, the influence of the things that lurk in those woods is seeping out into the idyllic settlement in the form of strange creatures, and dark whispers causing good men to sour into violence; Icos needs a hero. 
the folk of Icos are losing hope, and are reaching out. with a myriad of concerns and worries posted on message boards around the kingdom, someone must rise in aid to the good people of Icos before everyone falls under the loathsome shade cast by the menacing woods.

—description from the designer

Name: Monopoly Gamer: Mario Kart Power Pack – Metal Mario
Description:
The Monopoly brand has joined forces with Mario Kart in the Monopoly Gamer Mario Kart Board Game! With Monopoly Gamer Mario Kart Power Packs, character tokens grant unique abilities to optimize players' gameplay experience.

For use with the Monopoly Gamer Mario Kart Board Game.

Metal Mario's Super Star ability is: All other players skip their next Power-Up Die roll.
Metal Mario's Power-Up (activated by rolling a Lightning Bolt) is: After all other players drop 1 Coin, roll the numbered die, and move again. Follow the rules of that space.
Families: Video Game Theme: Super Mario Bros.

Name: Monopoly Gamer: Mario Kart Power Pack – Shy Guy
Description:
The Monopoly brand has joined forces with Mario Kart in the Monopoly Gamer Mario Kart Board Game! With Monopoly Gamer Mario Kart Power Packs, character tokens grant unique abilities to optimize players' gameplay experience.

For use with the Monopoly Gamer Mario Kart Board Game.

Shy Guy's Super Star ability is: Move up to 3 spaces forward or backward. Follow the rules of the space where you land.
Shy Guy's Power-Up (activated by rolling a green shell) is: The players in front of and behind you drop 3 Coins.
Families: Video Game Theme: Super Mario Bros.

Name: Monopoly Gamer: Mario Kart Power Pack – Donkey Kong
Description:
The Monopoly brand has joined forces with Mario Kart in the Monopoly Gamer Mario Kart Board Game! With Monopoly Gamer Mario Kart Power Packs, character tokens grant unique abilities to optimize players' gameplay experience.

For use with the Monopoly Gamer Mario Kart Board Game.

Donkey Kong's Super Star ability is: You may place a Banana on 2 of your Properties.
Donkey Kong's Power-Up (activated by rolling a Banana) is: You may remove any number of Bananas from the board. Collect 3 Coins from the Bank for each Banana you remove.
Families: Video Game Theme: Super Mario Bros.

Name: Monopoly Gamer: Mario Kart Power Pack – Rosalina
Description:
The Monopoly brand has joined forces with Mario Kart in the Monopoly Gamer Mario Kart Board Game! With Monopoly Gamer Mario Kart Power Packs, character tokens grant unique abilities to optimize players' gameplay experience.

For use with the Monopoly Gamer Mario Kart Board Game.

Rosalina's Superstar ability is: You may move to the next Super Star space. Pick up any coins you pas or land on.
Rosalina's Power-Up (activated by rolling coins) is: Take 1 Coin from each player.
Families: Video Game Theme: Super Mario Bros.

Name: Monopoly Gamer: Mario Kart Power Pack – Yoshi
Description:
The Monopoly brand has joined forces with Mario Kart in the Monopoly Gamer Mario Kart Board Game! With Monopoly Gamer Mario Kart Power Packs, character tokens grant unique abilities to optimize players' gameplay experience.

For use with the Monopoly Gamer Mario Kart Board Game.

Yoshi's Superstar ability is: Collect all Coins on the board.
Yoshi's Power-Up (activated by rolling a green shell) is: The player in front of you drops 3 coins. You may immediately pick them up without moving your token.
Families: Video Game Theme: Super Mario Bros.

Name: Monopoly Gamer: Mario Kart Power Pack – Bowser
Description:
The Monopoly brand has joined forces with Mario Kart in the Monopoly Gamer Mario Kart Board Game! With Monopoly Gamer Mario Kart Power Packs, character tokens grant unique abilities to optimize players' gameplay experience.

For use with the Monopoly Gamer Mario Kart Board Game.

Bowser's Super Star ability is: Steal 4 Coins from any player.
Bowser's Power-Up (activated by rolling a Spiny shell) is: The player with the most Coins drops 3. All other players drop 1. You drop none.
Families: Video Game Theme: Super Mario Bros.

Name: Gulf Strike: 2nd Edition Scenario Update
Description:
This expansion to Gulf Strike was published for owners of the first edition of Gulf Strike (1983). 
It adds scenarios and updates order of battles

This expansion was available separately as well as being included in updated boxed editions.

Components:

     scenario update booklet (16 pages)
     operational map D (Iraq)
     130 counters (half standard countersheet)

Name: Frostgrave: The Grimoire
Description:
The Grimoire is the ultimate resource for wizards as they set out on an expedition into the Frozen City in search of adventure, glory and power!

This set of cards features all the spells found in Frostgrave RPG: Fantasy Wargames in the Frozen City, Thaw of the Lich Lord, Into the Breeding Pits, Forgotten Pacts, The Frostgrave Folio, and The Maze of Malcor, and provides players with a quick and easy reference guide to their wizards' abilities.

Content: 122 Spell Cards

Name: Tempus
Description:
Tempus is a retro style card game that's fun for everyone! Inspired by the greats, like UNO, Skip-bo, Phase 10, and Rack-O.

Players control time to play all of their cards before their opponents!

Components: 1 travel case/game board, 1 instruction sheet, 168 cards, consisting of 12 each #1-#12 (clock cards), 18 n (wild) cards, and 6 Reverse time cards.

Reverse time cards: These cards dictate the counting order of the game. The first time they are played, they are played face up to change the direction to counterclockwise (backward) counting direction. The second time they are played face down to indicate clockwise direction. They are played to the side of the time zones, separate from the counting piles.

Objective: Play all of the cards in your countdown deck before your opponent! The game ends when a player has accumulated 365 points, and then the lowest score wins!

Setup:

     Deal 12 cards face down to each player, each player flips their top card over and places it on top of their cards to create the countdown pile.
     Reveal 4 cards face up in the 4 time zones in the center. If any n (wild) cards are revealed, cover them up with another card until 4 clock cards.
     If any reverse time cards are revealed, they are played to the side of the time zones.


Play: The player to the left of the dealer draws cards until they have 5 in their hand. They may use cards from their countdown pile, hand, or discards to count the hours of the clock in the time zone, according to the direction (forwards or backwards) in the directional area.

Counting in Tempus is cyclical, like a clock. Players will count 11-12-1 in forwards direction, and 1-12-11 in backwards direction.

If a player can play all 5 cards from their hand in a single turn, they can draw 5 more cards and continue playing

All n cards must be covered by the next clock card in the sequence before that players turn is over. If it cannot be covered, it is removed from the time zone and placed at the bottom of their countdown deck.

A player MUST count at least one card in the Time Zone from their countdown pile, hand, or discard per turn. They must draw cards into their hands until they can. If a player has more than 5 cards after discarding, they must place the excess cards at the bottom of their countdown pile.

A player ends their turn by discarding 1 card into one of their four discard piles. Cards may be stacked, but only the current top card of each discard pile is playable. Any remaining cards in a players hand carries over to their next turn, where they will draw until they have 5 again.

Play continues to the left until one player has used all of the cards in their countdown pile. All other players add up their cards remaining in their countdown piles and add it to their score. (1-4: 5 pts, 5-8: 10 pts, 9-12: 15 pts, n: 20, RT: 25)

Once a player has reached 365 points, the game is over, and the player with the lowest score wins!

—description from the designer

Name: Dead 'til Dawn: Dead Arm of the Law
Description:
Dead Arm of the Law is a 50-card expansion set that comes in its own tuck box.

Comes with 6 more Character cards, 16 more Event cards, and 16 more Equipment cards as well as 12 Setting cards - a type of card not available in the regular core set!

Setting cards are drawn at the start of the game and establish your game's storyline while introducing new rules, making each game played even more unique!

The expansion characters introduced include the Sheriff, Escaped Convict, Thief, CIA Agent, Scavenger, and Gambler.

Name: Gina Giraffe
Description:
Gina Giraffe is a card game where the players try to match the cards correctly. Each player starts with a card and they take turns drawing cards until someone end your giraffe row and win the game/round.

The game gets more dynamic with each turn because more cards at sight left on the game zone. It means that the players will need more visual speed and attention among others, to do not lose their chance, because the first person who complete Gina wins!

—description from the designer

Name: Hellboy: The Board Game – Box Full of Evil
Description:
The Kickstarter exclusive 'Box Full of Evil' contains the expansions

     Hellboy in Mexico,
     Darkness Calls,


and these additional unlocked stretch goal miniatures:

     Vladimir Giurescu + confrontation
     Floating heads + enemy card
     Oni + enemy card
     Igor Bromhead + enemy card

Name: Munchkin Gift Pack
Description: Munchkin Gift Pack includes Munchkin Lite, Munchkin Grimm Tidings, and Munchkin Spell Skool. It also includes 5 new cards illustrated by Len Peralta.

Name: Munchkin: Party Pack
Description: Munchkin: Party Pack has 15 party-themed cards to add to your Munchkin games and three copies each of five new cards to give away as party favors.

Name: Dickens A Christmas Carol Board Game
Description: Dickens A Christmas Carol Board Game features questions both on the story itself (10 points for each correct answer) and Dickens’s writing of the story (20 points). You pick which type of question you want to answer.

Name: Quarriors! Qultimate Quedition
Description:
In Quarriors!, each player plays as a Quarrior competing for glory in the eyes of Quiana, the Empress of Quaridia. Each player starts with an identical set of twelve dice in their dice bag. At the start of the game, creature and spell dice (dubbed "quarry") are dealt at random to form "the Wilds" in the center of the table. As play progresses, players roll their dice to attempt to summon creatures, cast spells, and harness the magical power of Quiddity (the in-game resource) to capture quarry from the Wilds to add to their repertoire and into their dice bag. Players draw and roll six dice a turn from their bag, meaning that controlling bag composition is key to victory.

Quarriors! is a fast-paced game in which players must strategically balance their choices each turn. Do you use your Quiddity to summon creatures in the hopes of scoring glory, or should you spend it all to capture more powerful quarry from the Wilds? Players must outmaneuver their opponents through strategic spell use, the acquisition of powerful quarry, and ultimately, by striking down opposing creatures in combat. If your creatures survive until your next turn, you will score glory points and move closer to victory!

Quarriors! Qultimate Quedition consists of the Quarriors! base game and all previously released expansions and promotional cards.

Name: Chiyo's Secret
Description:
You are a noble ally of the daimyo, perhaps with a secret agenda of your own. The hidden role game Chiyo's Secret has four teams: Loyal Allies, who seek to capture Chiyo and Fusanobu and send them to be executed for their crimes; Usurpers, who seek to lure Fusanobu and the Daimyo into a trap and seize power for themselves; Betrayers, who seek to betray the Daimyo and present Chiyo and Fusanobu to the Shogun instead; and the lone Motonaka who seeks to protect his parents, hiding them until the Shogun arrives.

While Chiyo and Fusanobu hide among the patrons of local establishments, players attempt to gather information and seek them out in order to successfully complete their objectives and win the game. They gain information by moving patrons between establishments and asking Motonaka questions. Motonaka may lie about the whereabouts of his parents once per game. The game ends when a player has met all of the conditions necessary for them to win the game.

Name: Endgame
Description:
Endgame is is a game where multiple spymasters are competing to control the world.Each player is given three spies at the beginning of the game. These spies can be used in a few different ways.

In the operations section of the board exists four cards. On the top right hand corner there is a circle with a number in it. That number is how many spies you need to allocate to purchase that card.

When you purchase a card you have two options with it. One, you can play the card and gain the effect of the card. A card can be played at any time even if its not your turn.

In the top left corner of the card is a star with a number inside of it. These are victory points points you get when the game is over. However if you play them you wont get victory point total

Another use of spies is to capture territory on the world map. If an area is undefended (Meaning there is no spy there) it only requires you to put one spy there. If there was 1 defending spy there you would have too expend 2 spies to capture it, if 2 are defending you would need 3 spies to capture, and so forth.

When controlling an area that area gives you certain perks. For example as long as you control north america you gain one extra worker. However once you lose influence over that area you lose the extra spy.

At the end of the game you will look and see who has influence over the seven continents. You would add up the total form areas (including bonuses for holding countries).

The person with the most victory points wins the game.

—description from the designer

Name: Feudum: Big Box
Description:
Feudum is an economic medieval game of hand and resource management for 2-5 players. With many strategies at their disposal, players optimize four actions per turn in attempt to score the most victory points over five epochs.

BIG BOX
The space-saving "Big Box" is the same size as the regular box. Includes:

Feudum Base Game
Feudum: Alter Ego
Feudum: Seals & Sirens
Feudum: Windmills & Catapults

BIG BOX Kickstarter Edition (KS)
The Kickstarter-edition"Big Box" is the same size as the regular box and includes all of the above PLUS Stretch Goals from the first Feudum Campaign:

- Royal Starting Player Marker
- Foil Pack 1
- Foil Pack 2
- Embroidered Haversack
- Foil-Stamped Wooden Vessels
- Stained Glass Abbey Card
- Gilded Progress Die
- Sword of Leinad Hologram
Families: Versions & Editions: Big Box Versions of Individual Games

Name: Myth: Dark Frontier Swordsworn expansion
Description:
This expansion for Myth comes in every copy of Myth: Dark Frontier.

Comes with:

1 Miniature
30 Card Novice Hero Deck
10 Card Journeyman Hero Deck
1 Hero Reference Card
2 Starting Gear cards
13 Exclusive Hero Myth Cards

The miniature is also used in Myth: Dark Frontier.

Name: Myth: Journeyman Stretch Goals Box
Description:
A single box containing all the printed materials from the Myth: Journeyman Kickstarter campaign.

Miniatures to use with these components are to be released separately.

Name: Starship Samurai: Shattered Alliances
Description:
Shattered Alliances is an explosive expansion for Starship Samurai, bringing more variety and methods for inflicting humiliating defeat upon your friends! Two new, beautifully sculpted mechs bring new abilities to humble your enemies and combo with your other forces. A whopping forty new action cards will shake up your games with a level of variety that will leave every player guessing at their opponents’ next moves. Many of these new action cards are clan-specific, bestowing even bigger, bolder effects on players allied with the right clans.

—description from the publisher

Name: Myth: Journeyman Modules
Description: A box containing the printed materials for all 8 Myth Modules offered during the Journeyman kickstarter. Miniatures are not included.

Name: Myth: Avatar of Stone Banner Saga Crossover expansion
Description: Two cards for Myth from the Banner Saga warbands kickstarter campaign.

Name: Myth: Dredge Minion Pack
Description:
Released as an optional addon from the Banner Saga Warbands Kickstarter Campaign.

Comes with 10 miniatures and 1 monster card.

Name: Marine-Spiel
Description:
This turn of the century German game stands out for its magnificent artwork and very unusual board. The box cover shows a pre-dreadnought battleship slicing through the sea, from off its starboard bow, while the board initially unfolds to show a side-on view of the ship with no apparent game features.

However, the board image then unfolds further from the ship's main deckline to reveal a schematic of the ship's compartments, a 46-space roll-and-move track from a bunkroom in the bow to the engine room. The artwork in the gameboard portion is highly detailed, with images of furniture, seamen at work and varied ship's stores, but in a plain red ink against a white background.

There are six playing pieces, highly detailed human figures in different uniforms and dress, printed on cardboard and standing in coloured wooden disks.

Both the cover illustration and the board take considerable artistic liberties with technical details. The ship on the cover looks very much like the 1898-commissioned pre-dreadnought battleship Kaiser Wilhelm III, but has an extra funnel and is missing a side turret. The ship on the board has the correct two funnels, but is missing the barbette gun beside the main forward turret as well as one of the three side turrets, and has no rear turret. The ships fly non-existent and therefore neutral flags of horizontal stripes, but are red-yellow-blue on the cover and red-blue-yellow on the board.

The cover art is signed with the initials SR, while the board art is unsigned, which may explain the differences in detail. The lack of any publisher information is unusual for a German game of such high quality.

—user summary

Name: Outlaws In A Strange Land
Description:
Assume the role of a demon outlawed from hell, now finding refuge and a life of adventure in the mortal realm of the American Wild West. Set out to unravel a web of ancient lies and conspiracies as you’re hunted down by the forces of darkness.

Battle a variety of supernatural foes, solve mysteries and encounter memorable characters as you explore a truly weird west in the American Frontier.


Outlaws In A Strange Land is a narrative-driven solo/co-op adventure RPG card game for 1-4 players and requires the use of a companion app.

Play through a variety of narrative stories and adventures, crafting your playstyle as you advance your character, unlock new skills, acquire hordes of loot and collect memorable companions that aid you.

Experience truly innovative combat using your hand-crafted character in an expressive condition and environment system meant to keep each fight fresh and fun against a variety of unique foes.

—

Name: RPGQuest Dungeons
Description:
RPGQuest Dungeons is a RPG (Role Playing Game) and Modern Board game that takes place inside Stone Labyrinths, dungeons and secret passages called "Dungeons" or "Seth's Tunnels" in the Kingdom of Arcadia.
Legends say that the ancient Egyptian god of death built these living labyrinths in the Underworld and that these labyrinths could change and change their position over time, making the task of mapping them impossible.
Portals and passages sometimes pop up in the Arcadia Mountain Chains, often accompanied by reports of attacks by monsters and other creatures in nearby villages. Seth's Tunnels serve as shelters for Orcs, Goblins, Cultists, Necromancers, the Living Dead and the terrible Svartalfenheim (The Black Elves), as well as the Scorpion People and other even more terrifying creatures.
Dungeons can be ancient abandoned mausoleums, ancient crypts of lost dynasties, subterranean labyrinths built by already extinct races, dens or orches and caches of orcs, gnolls or goblins, serving as the basis for powerful necromantics or even demonic portals for other dimensions. All of these sites have legends about lost treasures and valuable artifacts and attract the attention of Kingdom Adventurers groups.
Our game begins when a group of Four Brave Heroes decides to investigate these locations in their quest during Hero's Journey.
The RPGQuest can be played from 2 to 5 people (or up to 6 people if one of them takes the role of Narrator). Each of them will take on the role of one or more Heroes (out of 12 initials) within a team of 4 Adventurers and together they must face the challenges within the Dungeons.

RPGQuest is played in stages, called ADVENTURES. During an Adventure, a Hero can find or gain treasures and valuable artifacts. Weapons, Armor, and Magic Items that can be used in the following Adventures of a Campaign. You can also improve the powers and attributes of your Characters by making them stronger and more powerful on your Journey.
Heroes must act together to win the Adventures. RPGQuest is a Cooperative game.

—description from the publisher

Name: Mysterium: Blue Jay
Description:
This promo is given out by the publisher at conventions.

Add this new vision card to the Vision card deck of the ghost.

Name: Lunik
Description:
An extremelly rare greek board game from the late 1950's. It can be played from 2 to 5 players. Every player move with the sum of the two dices and he must collect all the needed items to launch rockets with their sattelites. 
The winner of the game is the player who launches the most rockets.

Name: Age of Towers: The Mountain Spirits
Description:
A new threat is coming! The Spirit Mountains invade your path with this new promo Event card!

Mini promo expansion.

• 1 Event Card 
• 6 Tokens
• 1 Overview Card

Name: Man-Eater: A Four Against Darkness Adventure
Description:
Predator and prey. Who is who?

Guildmaster Evos is wounded, his bodyguard beheaded by a ferocious man-tiger creature that ran away. The monster is hiding into the Forest of Thraa -- an area of woods dotted by ivy-covered ancient ruins. Thraa, where once a proud town stood -- a town that was destroyed by a vengeful druid cult.

"Find the beast!" yells Evos, clutching his bleeding neck. "I will pay three hundred golden crowns to the first adventurer who brings me back its head!"

This adventure for Four Against Darkness may be played by 1 to 4 players, in solo or cooperative mode, with all adventurers moving independently on a hex map. A black and white map is in the book, and a larger, full color map that can be printed up to A3 size can be downloaded, for those who want to use miniatures or paper figures to represent their characters' position.

Name: Four Against the Netherworld: A Supplement for Four Against Darkness
Description:
Abandon all hope!

Four Against The Netherworld is a supplement for Four Against the Darkness, for character levels 6-9.

In its pages you will find:

New classes: Demonologist, Cambion, Cleric of Zur, Cleric of Foryos, and a reworked Paladin;

A complete economic system for the Netherworld;

Rules for hex-based exploration, with plenty of terrain types, and a downloadable color map of the known regions of the Netherworld;

Six new spells for wizards and cambions;

New Reactions: Burn Souls, Capture, Conversion, Demonic Pact, Mercenaries, Demand Obeisance, and more;

Tables to generate encounters and events; Plenty of new, deadly monsters, including randomly generated Lovecraftian aberrations.

This is not a stand alone game. To use it, you need a copy of Four Against Darkness and Four Against the Abyss.

Name: The Game Changers
Description:
Welcome to The Game Changers — eighty cards that can spice up ANY game you play! Yes, that's right, take any board or card game you like, and use one of the changers to mix things up! You decide how you'd like to change your favorite tabletop games.

This game — well, expansion for all games really — adds eleven possible modules to spice up your game experience. Pick a changer you would like to use, and add it to the game of your choice.

Name: Supreme Leader
Description:
Do you have what it takes to rule as Fuhrer, Il Duce, Vozhd, King of the Golden Horde, Holy Roman Emperor, or Leader of the Only Free World?

Supreme Leader is a game of political survival that explores power dynamics in the comfort of the home. Every player will be tested on their ability to make and hold alliances, build a strong economy, and eliminate other belligerent leaders to the United Nations. You will produce an income, make deals with other players, bribe your way out of tough spots, and purchase cards to bolster your plays and diminish your foes' powers. However, be careful of how and who you send to the United Nations because they will have to vote for you to become Supreme Leader in the final round of the game.

Name: Rally Round the Flag: Corps Command
Description:
Rally Round the Flag is an operational and tactical game system set in the American Civil War and focuses on both the historical battle of Gettysburg and other What If scenarios around the Gettysburg battle site.

Rally Round the Flag can be played at three levels. The Corps Command game is played with each unit representing a division. The Division Command game is played with each unit representing a brigade. And the Brigade Command game is played with each unit representing a regiment.

To win Rally Round the Flag, a player must force their opponent to retreat from the battlefield or control more Victory Points at the end of the game. The system is designed to focus on the mechanics of holding key pieces of terrain and using the battle system of card play to simulate the tactics and training of each unit.

-description from publisher

Name: Wer das Glück hat, führt die Braut nach Hause
Description:
The deck consists of 16 cards. Each player get 4 Cards and Pays 6 tokens into the cash box. The remaining 4 cards are laid out front up on the table. Each player gets to exchange one card of his hand with one of the remaining cards. Für this he has to pay 3 tokens. Afterwards wins and losses are determined and another turn begins. The game ends, if a player has the bride, one groom and the ring on his hand. All other combinations cause wins or losses or are neutral.

If a player has the ring, the key and one of the two grooms he may offer  tho buy the bride from the player who holds her. If the other player accepts the offer, the bride and two other cards are shuffled and the player with the groom and ring draws one card.
If he draws the bride, he wins the game and the contents of the cash box.

—user summary

Name: Route 66 Dice Game
Description:
The player rolls all five dice and scores any sixes rolled. If no sixes are rolled, their turn ends, they score 0, and the dice pass to the next player.

They can continue their turn and roll again, but if no sixes are rolled, they lose any points for that turn.

The first player to reach 2451 miles (the length of Route 66) wins.

Name: That's a Wrap
Description:
Congratulations!  You and a group of other movie directors have been hired by a major film studio on a five-year contract.  All you have to do is make one movie a year, simple right?  By the end of the contract, only the director with the most of the prestigious Oskie awards will get an extension, so watch out for your competition.

That’s a Wrap is played over four rounds, each one represented the cycle of a movie’s production.  As directors, the players build the movie from scratch, first choosing a genre after seeing the list of actors and scripts available for purchase.  Each genre, actor, and script have different values that reflect their ability to make money and win awards, with some cards being more specialized in either field.  After players choose their genres, they purchase scripts and hire actors via bidding.  Before any movies can be released, they have to go through a bit of studio meddling; each player plays a card that may help their movie or hinder others’.  If a certain movie is a passion project, a player may elect to keep their film from being meddled with once per game.  After movies are shot and finished, they go to market, where each movie makes some amount of profit.  However, the season isn’t over until the Oskies are awarded.  The highest box office film takes home the Audience Choice award, and the more artistically inclined ones can vie for three different awards, including for screenplay, performance, and director.  Each director will go through this cycle four times, making a different film each time, and progressively getting access to more impressive genres, higher quality scripts, and A-List actors.  At the end of the game, the director with the most Oskies wins!

—user summary

Name: FLAUTZ!
Description:
Exchange the right spells, summon magical creatures and win the secret contest of the wizards’ apprentices - the FLAUTZ!

As a panicking apprentice 2-10 players attempt to get hold of appropriate scrolls to summon their familiars. Through exchanging cards in hand with spell cards in the center of the table, players gather either spell cards of the same color with consecutive values or spell cards of different colors with the same value.

The purpose is to have the highest rated spell with the most summoned familiars by the end of the last game round. A so called FLAUTZ! promises the best chance of winning a match and may end it prematurely. In the end, the winner of the competition is the player with the most points or the most magic crystals, depending on the mode of play.

FLAUTZ! can be played in two game modes. The first one is played in several matches until a player has collected a specific amount of magic crystals. The second ends after a predefined number of matches and the winner is the player with the most points in total.

-description from designer

Name: FLAUTZ!: Necronomicon
Description:
The Necronomicon expansion offers a new way of winning the game and also adds new arena layouts with an additional mechanism. The five Necronomicon special cards will expand your spells by the number 6 and collecting three of them actually wins you a match!

But beware, using the Necronomicons also comes with a downside if you are not the winner of a match!

-description from designer

Name: FLAUTZ!: Voodoo
Description:
The Voodoo expansion comes with two new apprentices that have some special rules and can cast a Voodoo FLAUTZ! With these two new apprentices you might even play games of up to 12 players. In addition, they have brought their voodoo dolls with them. These act as jokers and will help all players casting their spells. Lastly the arena has been turned into a voodoo den and offers new layouts and a new mechanism.

-description from designer

Name: DiceWar: Rise of Xeladron
Description:
Step through magical portals to foreign worlds and let Xeladron shake the Warlands.

DiceWar: Rise of Xeladron is the third expansion for the DiceWar series, and it can be used in combination with all other expansions. In this expansion are six new creatures with new effects. You can step through portals, fly over you enemies, and destroy your own creatures to eliminate several creatures together.

—description from publisher

Name: Soldiers of God: Tabletop Wargames Rules for the Raids, Battles and Sieges of the Crusades
Description:
Soldiers of God is a miniatures wargame about the crusades to the Holy Land: it always pits a Crusader army against a Saracen one.

The core of the game is in the action cards, the play of one allows the left, centre, or right of the army to carry out the action of the card, such as advancing or shooting. At the start of the game, each player choses three cards that they will have access to each turn; at the start of each turn they also draw four random ones so that they have a hand of seven. Accordingly, what an army can do will be strongly influenced by the initial plan as indicated by the chosen cards: if you chose a "attack on left" card, you'll always be able to do so, if not any such ambitions are at the mercy of card draw.

Combat resolution is more traditional: a unit in combat rolls one die per stand it consists of, needing a certain number to hit depending depending on weapons. Hits cause disorder unless negated by resolve saves, and a unit that takes more disorder than it has stands routs off the battlefield.

Name: A Game of Knights and Knaves: The Basic Game
Description:
A Game of Knights and Knaves is a set of miniatures wargames rules covering medieval warfare and medievalesque fantasy.

The basic rules mechanics will be familiar to players of the DBX family of games: figures are grouped onto stands of uniform width classed into a number of generic types (heavy infantry, light cavalry, knights, etc) and combat is resolved stand by stand, each rolling a die, adding a combat factor depending in its type and opposition, and comparing to the opponent's. Each turn a player rolls a die to see how many command points he has to move his troops with, any within range of enemy then fighting automatically.

Name: Dark Death
Description:
China circa 168 CE

Chinese traditional medicine is the oldest continuous medical system in the world. When the Angel of Death spread a devastating plague along the Silk Roads into China the physicians must work together to eliminate the disease or die themselves.

One player is the Angel of Death placing disease disks on the intersections on a 8 x 8 squared board. As he spreads disease the rest of the players move the physicians and battle to contain it and even destroy it completely.

Players take turns to move any physician diagonally except the one moved on the last turn. Move next to the disease to eliminate it, but with another physician close by to protect you. If you are not prepared to sacrifice some of the physicians lives, you cannot eliminate much of the disease. If the physician jumps over a disease, it is eliminated from the board and the game. Physicians may continue jumping as long as
they can eliminate disease.

The Angel of Death places more disease at the end of each physician player’s turn. A physician, surrounded by diseases, four in the middle of the board, two on the side of the board, or one in a corner, is killed and removed from the game.

The game is over when either:

• When there is no disease left to place.
• All the physicians have been killed.
• There is no disease on the board.

Total the numbers on the physicians, that is their score. The total number of disease on the board is the Angel of Death’s score. The side with the highest score wins the game.

Dark Death is only available as part of the Ancient World Multi Game System.

Name: Coleopterra
Description:
Competitive game for 2-4 players. Each player controls 5 beetles, who must collect the most points by getting food tokens from the board to their lairs. Each beetle has a special movement to move the tokens and also, to fight against the enemy beetles.

In each turn beetle must do any three of these actions: walk, turn, fly, collect food tokens ir attack an enemy beetle.

The "token food" looks like beetle's food. When these are collected in the lair, these become in victory points or support beetles.
Finally, a player could win reaching the points goal or collecting the most points in a pre set time.

—description from the designer

Name: Combat Command: Battalion Level Rules for World War II – Basic Game
Description:
In Combat Command you take the role of a Battlegroup Commander maneuvering a mixed force that can range from a reinforced infantry battalion task force to a battalion sized panzer kampgruppe.  The game recreates World War II tactical battles by using an innovative integrated sequence of play which meshes the actions of each player in order to simulate the swirling battles of the period.

The game allows you to command forces modeled on historical battlegroups in games based on actual battles or in hypothetical match ups between roughly evenly matched forces.  All technical data is presented in one table covering a wide range of equipment used in World War II from French Somuas to German Panthers.  The easy to use Quick Reference data chart allows players to concentrate on maneuver and not on minutiae yet covers all the important weapon systems and hardware innovations of the war.

—description from the publisher

Name: A Thief's Fortune: Gossipmonger promo card
Description:
This is an additional character card for A Thief's Fortune.

This card is included in the Kickstarter edition and will be available at Essen SPIEL '18.

Gameplay Effect: Adds a lamp basic resource and a danger token to the future. As Activate Action the Gossipmonger resets a neutral character.

Name: MEMOTEP
Description:
MEMOTEP is the educational board game promoting learning languages to put between all hands.

This new method of collective learning of a foreign language allows students to have fun together in class (up to 35 players), from the age of 7 years, while learning the most important words and phrases
useful of a language.

With MEMOTEP, it becomes child's play to learn or improve in any what language, to listen to or train to pronounce words and phrases through the free mobile app who evaluates your pronunciation.

The board represent an antic egyptian pyramid from which each player will try to climb on and reach the top at first place with an exact amount of coins to win the game

On his turn, each player have to throw a dice for going futher on the pyramid and to translate all the 5 words of a same card depending of the color of the board's box he just reached.

Every good answer win 2 coins and aim to collect the amount of coins necessary to win the game.

—user summary

Name: Finding Nessie
Description:
The lake of Loch Ness is shrouded with mystery. Every self-respecting monster connoisseur must attempt to capture the image of the famous Loch Ness Monster, but Nessie, turns out, is a bit camera shy, so getting a picture is not just a matter of pushing a button on your camera.

In Finding Nessie, each player takes on a role of a diver exploring the lake. During their turn, they get a chance at peeking through the muddy waters. But things aren't always what they seem: Was that a tail or just a trick of the eye? Or might it be the rare lucky fish? Be the first to piece the photograph together and make the discovery of the century!

—description from the publisher

Name: Occupation
Description: A roll-and-move game on a Monopoly-style board from 1940s, found in Jersey, that uses subversive jokes to mock wartime life.

Name: Tybor the Builder: At the King's Behest
Description:
Tybor the Builder: At the King's Behest consists of twenty-four new cards (four of them are rule / deck cards) comprising three modules that can be added to the Tybor the Builder base game, individually or in any combination. The three modules are:

1) Royal Decrees

This module offers ten cards which show a royal decree. These decrees can be fulfilled in a similar manner as the Public Objectives from the base game. The difference is that the decrees are fulfilled in game and can only be fulfilled by one player.

2) The Councilmen

This module adds a new kind of character who is offering a new symbol and bonus accordingly. If a Councilman becomes a citizen of your tableau, each Legal Text symbol is worth 1 point for every set of discounts of all four colors.

3) The Mystery

This module adds four new buildings to the game. These buildings not only offer the usual victory points, but also serve as one symbol of your choice for game end scoring.

Name: Hand Circus
Description:
In Hand Circus', you look at the mission card and use the components and your hand to perform a show as requested. Whoever performs it last gets a blue ball from the circus master as they need more practice

A flashy circus performs by hand!

Game Setup
(1) Each player takes one of each red, yellow, and green disc, a hat, a tiger, an elephant, and a stick.
(2) Shuffle the cards and make a facedown pile in the center of the table and set the audience pieces as many as one less than the number of players near the card deck. 
(3) Set 12 blue discs next to the card deck.

Game Play 

     The red band is there to indicate the thumb.


(1) Someone reveals a card from the deck, and then everyone starts to perform the show which is shown on the card. 
(2) Fulfill the mission and take the audience. When all the audiences are gone, check if players have performed correctly. 

     If a player incorrectly performed a show, the player has to return the audience piece. Then the players who have no audience perform again to win the audience. 


(3) When a round ends, the player with no audience piece gets a blue disc.

End of the Game 
Each blue disc is -1 point. Anytime during the game, if a player gets the specific amount of the blue discs, the player is eliminated from the game. (For a 4-player game: 4 discs, 3-player: 5 discs, 2-player: 6 discs) 

     Remove the audience piece as the player gets eliminated. 


Play until one player remains. The player wins the game.

Name: Chain of Command: Blitzkrieg 1940 – A Handbook for Wargaming the Fall of France and the Low Countries
Description: A 124 page handbook provides a comprehensive coverage of the campaign in France and the Low Countries in 1940. Included is an historical account of the campaign in the West, as well as whole raft of new rules to cover the events of that summer. New theater specific rules include Assault boats and river crossings, parachute drops, glider landings, bicycles, horse mounted troops and motorcycles.

Name: Inside
Description:
Inside is a game in which you can learn about each other's personal stories. Aren't you curious about what others have in their mind? Don't you want to know what's inside of a person you've just met today or a person you have known for a long time? Inside is here to open the door for you.

Randomly pick three cards from 101 story cards. Players other than the active player pick a topic tile. The active player secretly marks what they have in mind with the answer cards. The other players guess what the true answers are with the given clues.

Players gain 1VP (victory point) per card they guessed correctly. The active player gain VP equivalent to the numbers of the wrong answers from all players

Round 1 ends after all players have been the active player. Whoever has the most VP at the end of the round 2 is declared the winner.

Name: Einhorn Glitzerglück: Freunde-Quartett
Description:
Glitterluck and her unicorn girlfriends are playing Quartets today! Who wants to join in? With a little concentration and the right amount of luck, you can collect four of the same cards to form a quartet. The reward is a cloud crystal. Who can collect the most cloud crystals?

-from the publisher's website

It's a family game in which the player must collect 4 identical cards to form a family.
It takes place in the wonderful land of the unicorn.

Contents: 32 Quartets cards, 6 cloud cards, 8 cloud crystals, 1 set of instructions.

-user summary

Name: Cerebria: The Inside World – Forces of Balance
Description:
As Bliss and Gloom struggle for control of the Inside World, a new force enters the fray. Neither judge nor spectator, Balance is an active participant, striving to ensure that no side achieves dominance. Both Bliss and Gloom are important for the health of Cerebria, and Balance seeks a way for them to coexist in harmony.

The Forces of Balance expansion extends the world of Cerebria by adding a third side to the game with two new Spirits; unpredictable Intuition and wise Reason. The Balance game mode makes it possible for six players to play at once, and it also works for fewer numbers of players.

The Balance side has also some new mechanics. Their Emotions, the way they Invoke Emotions, gain Essence or Fortify are all uniquely tied to the playstyle of Balance.

Balance players have their own method to gather final scores during the game. They do not compete for the Common Aspiration. Instead, they have a Hidden Aspiration with two equivalent conditions.  Just like Bliss and Gloom, Balance wins by having the most points at the end of the game from Identity Fragments and the Wheel of Intentions.

—description from the publisher

Name: Planetarium: Primordial
Description:
Primordial, the first expansion for Planetarium, adds a new frost line to the board, and new cards that allow you to heat and cool planets for extra points at the end of the game. A new Late Bombardment effect clears the evolution track and re-distributes matter around the board, and also creates comets, which can be used as "wild" matter.

-description from designer

This expansion adds two modules to the base game: Epochs and Frost Line. One or the other or both may be added.

Epochs: The solar system begins with no planets. A player may, instead of moving a Matter token or a Planet, create a Protoplanet. Later, a player may play a Proto Evolution card to turn the Protoplanet into a Planet. The first time the Acceleration space is reached, it triggers the Late Heavy Bombardment instead (all the matter on the evolution track fills the empty solar system spaces, and comets may appear. The second time the Acceleration space is reached, Acceleration occurs normally.

Frost Line: This line lies between orbits III and IV (it moves in or out if the Red Dwarf or A-Type star are used). The Low, High, and Final Evolution cards of the normal game are replaced by those in the expansion. Planetary evolution now tracks heat and cold markers. If using the Variable star token, players may spend victory points to vary the star's brightness a notch up or down; this moves the Frost Line accordingly.

Name: Everdell: Pearlbrook
Description:
Explore a new underwater society in Pearlbrook, the first expansion for Everdell!

Pearlbrook introduces a new side board, the river board, where you'll send your frog ambassador to gather a new resource: pearls. You'll also encounter new aquatic critters and constructions! Collect enough pearls and you can construct fabulous wonders and adornments, to make your city the pride of Everdell!

—description from publisher

Name: Tower of Disa
Description:
A game of dexterity for 2 to 4 people; usually played by 2 people. Comes with a 52 "logs" (dowels). Each dowel is about 4 1/8" long.

You begin by laying a base of parallel logs and then alternate turns to add a log one at a time. The last person to lay a log on the stack without upsetting the tower is the winner.

Name: Kingdoms Wars
Description:
Pen and Paper games played with 3 dice, pen and paper. You are the founder of kingdom you can write your kingdoms name to top of paper. you should play at least A4 paper. You are rolling dice for resources each turn 1=Cow 2=People 3=Culture 4=Iron 5=Stone 6=Food you and your opponent keeping paper in front of them without showing to someone. you should write top of the paper side by side soldier, food, farm, people, cow, milk, iron, mine, stone, wall, culture, then roll dice for who will be first, then roll 3 dice.
  
For example you roll 1,3,6 then you should write under of cow 1 under of culture 3 under of food 6, you are starting with 20 food if you run your food because peoples and soldiers eats 1 food per turn your peoples starts to die, you roll a single dice and that much people die. you are gaining resources same as dice number, but if you roll same number at all dices like 111,333...  then you get double of it 333=18 resources.

You are trying to destroy your opponent by soliders, you can create solider with 1 iron and 1 people,you can declare war if you have more than 20 solider , if you decide to attack     then you can see your opponent paper if he has wall your 5 solider dies for per wall then walls demolish, then rest of the your soliders and your opponent solider starts to clash and who has most of the soliders win, if you win and playing more than 2 people you can take all of his resources to your kingdom.
You can build or buy something for improve your kingdom in your turn

    Wall = 25 stone killing 5 soldiers if they attacking
     Soldier = iron+people
     Farm = 15 stone+people producing 1 food per turn
     Mine =20 stone+people producing 1 iron per turn
     You can buy people with 5 food
     You can kill cows for 10 food
     People can drink milk instead of eating food but you cant produce new peoples with milk
     If you have more than 30 culture you can spend 30 culture and roll 3 dice and steal that much solider from your opponent.



My advice if you are not trusting your opponent you can play open kingdom paper in front of you so no-one can cheat.

—description from the designer

Name: Escape Room: The Game (Escape Rooms II)
Description:
Race against the clock: you have 60 minutes to enter the correct keys on the Chrono decoder to escape. It will count down remaining time, and emit intense sounds to let you know you’re almost out of time. Can you escape?

3 exciting escape rooms with varying levels of difficulty. Work together to escape from Secret Agent, The Dentist, and Space Station.

Note:
There are several other versions of this game, with a varying set of escape rooms. Each of these has a separate BGG entry:

     This edition (English): Secret Agent + Space Station + The Dentist
     Escape Room: The Game 2 (Spanish): Secret Agent + Space Station + The Dentist + Casino
     Escape Room: Spillet 2 (Norwegian, Czech): Secret Agent + Space Station + The Dentist + Murder Mystery
     ì´ìŠ¤ì¼€ì´í”„ ë£¸: 2íƒ„ (Escape Room: The Game 2) (Korean): Secret Agent + Space Station + The Dentist + Nuclear Countdown


The box that is sold in the UK as "Escape Room: The Game 2" contains a completely different set of escape rooms:

     Escape Room: The Game 3 (US, UK as "Escape Room: The Game 2") Panic on the Titanic + Dawn of the Zombies + Alice in Wonderland
Families: Series: Escape Room – The Game (Identity Games International B.V.)

Name: Rusty Trombone
Description:
The hilarious new party game where you and your friends get to come up with new sex positions. What’s a Dusty Suitcase? What’s a Muddy Hobo? It’s only as vulgar as you and your friends make it!

Game play: Dealer draws five cards from the deck and selects two cards to form a new phrase and puts them on the table, discard remaining cards back into the deck.

Players write down what they think the description is, it can be anything you want. Answers tend to be more risque, but don't have to be. Everyone hands their answer to the person sitting next to the dealer, who now has to read all of the answer out loud.

Dealer selects which answer they like best and game play continues in a clockwise directions. Game is over when one player wins 10 rounds or is the last person to pass out.

Game contains 216 cards, which allows over 45,000 combinations of phrases!

-description from designer

Name: Courageous Tragedy: The Battle of Belchite, August-September 1937
Description:
Due to the stalemate at Brunete the Republicans launched a new offensive further east in Aragon Province. The new offensive would again be spearheaded by the International Brigades by the Army of the East. The goal was to break through the Nationalist lines and take the key city of Zaragosa. Success here would compel the Nationalists to withdraw, bringing relief to the city of Madrid and demonstrating the Republican cause could still win the civil war. The Nationalists had stripped this portion of the front of troops, with only three divisions holding the line. Despite their superiority in men and tanks, as well as the commitment of nearly all of the Republican air force to the offensive, the Nationalists grimly held to their positions and were able to disrupt the Republican attack. The fighting was particularly hard at Belchite, where fighting degenerated into a house-to-house slugfest that left the city in ruins. By the start of September the Nationalists had brought up reinforcements and gained air superiority. However, the Republican’s determination managed to hold off the Nationalist counter-offensive, and by the 6th a stalemate in the war returned here.

Can you do as well or better than your historical counterparts?

Each copy of Courageous Tragedy is composed of the following:

•    Two 11 by 17 hex map sheets
•    81 un-mounted, double-sided counters
•    8 pages of rules

As with the other Battles of the Spanish Civil War Series (on Teruel and Brunete), players use a standard deck of playing cards to activate their units and determine some game events. A six sided die is also used to resolve combat. The game is designed by Paul Rohrbaugh and features graphics by Ilya Kudriashov.

A card set for the game is also available. The card set replaces the standard deck of playing cards called for in the rules, features graphics by Ilya Kudriashov, and has rules reminders on pertinent cards.

-description from designer
Families: Series: Standard Deck Activation System (High Flying Dice Games)

Name: Steam Pirates
Description:
In the vast world of Materia, two factions are fighting to seize power over the people who wish to live peacefully in their cities. The Pirate Syndicate is a business-driven corporation that vies to gain as much power by exploiting the "honest" merchants. Their Queen Pirate loves to use the fastest vessel in all of Materia, The Dreadnought, to dominate the sea of clouds. The Great British Empire is a monarch regime that controls most of the known city-islands. The king's hand, the Governor of the seven seas, is the most dominant person who loves to enforce his laws by lashing out his fearsome Flying Fortress after contraband dealing pirates.

In Steam Pirates, each player builds their own trading network of piracy by dealing in four types of goods: coal, rum, firearms, and automatons. Your goal is to capitalize the "open" market by selling your goods while maneuvering your frigate to explore new markets and new resourceful allies.

—description from the publisher

Name: Foodie Kitchen
Description:
Foodie Kitchen is a strategic dish building card game for anyone and everyone that loves food! Become the head foodie of Foodie Kitchen by preparing delicious dishes and collecting kitchen tools. Along the way, you’ll have many action cards, such as Dumpster Dive, Art of Chopsticking, and Steal The Recipe, to stop the other foodies from winning!

Foodie Kitchen is fun, quick, easy-to-learn and has just the right balance of strategy and luck so that no one game is ever the same. Play Foodie Kitchen with family and friends!

Foodie Kitchen is a light and casual game for 2-5 players and plays in 15-30 mins.


HOW TO PLAY:

1. All foodies start the game with 5 Mini Mart cards.
